title: Historical stock splits and corporate actions related to IAU stock

content.text: iShares Gold Trust (IAU) is launched by BlackRock, Inc. The fund is designed to track the price of gold bullion.
IAU declares a 1-for-10 reverse split. Every 10 shares of IAU are consolidated into 1 share, effectively increasing the share price.
IAU undergoes a 4-for-1 stock split. Each shareholder receives 3 additional shares for every share held, resulting in a lower share price.
Another 4-for-1 stock split is announced by IAU. Shareholders will receive 3 additional shares for every share held, further reducing the share price.
IAU announces a 2-for-1 stock split. Each shareholder is granted an additional share for every share held, adjusting the share price accordingly.

The iShares Gold Trust (IAU) was launched on October 20, 2005. Since then, it has undergone multiple stock splits to adjust the share price. In 2010, a 1-for-10 reverse split increased the share price, while subsequent 4-for-1 stock splits in 2017 and 2019 decreased the share price. In 2021, a 2-for-1 stock split was announced. These corporate actions aimed to manage the share price in relation to the underlying gold bullion tracked by IAU.
